```{r}
adult = read.table("http://archive.ics.uci.edu/ml/machine-learning-databases/adult/adult.data",
        sep=",",header=F,col.names=c("age", "type_employer", "fnlwgt", "education", 
                "education_num","marital", "occupation", "relationship", "race","sex",
                "capital_gain", "capital_loss", "hr_per_week","country", "income"),
        fill=FALSE,strip.white=T)

library(randomForest)
library(caret)
library(ROCR)
adult$income <- factor(adult$income)

# Random Forest with m = 2
ffit <- randomForest(income ~ age + education_num + race + sex,   data=adult, importance = TRUE, mtry=2)
prob <- predict(ffit, type="prob")[,2]

# k-nn with k = 5
ffit2 <- knn3(income ~ age + education_num + race + sex, data=adult, k=5)
prob2 <- predict(ffit2, newdata = adult, type="prob")[,2]

# Random Forest (red) vs k-nn (blue)
fit.pred = prediction(prob, adult$income)
fit.perf = performance(fit.pred,"tpr","fpr")
plot(fit.perf, col="red3")
fit.pred2 = prediction(prob2, adult$income)
fit.perf2 = performance(fit.pred2,"tpr","fpr")
plot(fit.perf2, col="blue3", add=TRUE)
abline(a=0,b=1)

# AUC for Random Forest
fit.pred = prediction(prob, adult$income)
fit.perf = performance(fit.pred,"auc")
fit.perf@y.values[[1]]

# AUC for k-nn (best result - 0.85)
fit.pred = prediction(prob2, adult$income)
fit.perf = performance(fit.pred,"auc")
fit.perf@y.values[[1]]
```
